meanings.definition: A vertical bar between the panes of a window or the panels of a screen.
meanings.sent1: The mullion in the window divided the glass into sections.
meanings.sent2: She looked through the mullion to see the garden outside.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to climb the mullion like a ladder.
meanings.sent4: The mullion stood tall and straight, like a soldier guarding the window.
meanings.sent5: The mullion cast a shadow on the floor, creating a pattern of light and dark.

meanings.definition: To divide or separate with a mullion.
meanings.sent1: He decided to mullion the large window to create smaller sections.
meanings.sent2: The architect mullioned the glass wall to add structure to the design.
meanings.sent3: She playfully mullioned the room with imaginary lines, pretending to be an artist.
meanings.sent4: The decision to mullion the space brought a sense of organization to the layout.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter carefully mullioned the frame, ensuring each section was perfectly aligned.
